description: From black +â€Ž board, because such surfaces were once typically made of black slate.

entries.meaning: A large flat surface, finished with black slate or a similar material, that can be written upon with chalk and subsequently erased; a chalkboard.

verbs.description: blackboard (third-person singular simple present blackboards, present participle blackboarding, simple past and past participle blackboarded)

entries.meaning: To use a blackboard to assist in an informal discussion.
